column4: what would cause a file (folder) to not be able to be deleted, even as root?
if it's immutable bit is set (see the chattr and lsattr commands)
lsattr scalable/ -> lsattr: Inappropriate ioctl for device
what sort of files are in scalable/ ?
ls -l /usr/share/icons/hicolor/scalable - you should have the same files i would imagine
and lsattr on that directory works fine here :/
there is something wrong with my directory, not sure why.   my post on the forums for some background http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=1080798#post1080798
did you have a look at that pastebin?
none sorry :(  (only knew about chattr making files undeleteable by root)
